metadata.title: CVE-2022-48565 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An XML External Entity (XXE) issue was discovered in Python through 3.9.1.The plistlib module no longer accepts entity declarations in XML plistfiles to avoid XML vulnerabilities.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48565` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.8 - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.9
libpython3.8 - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.9
libpython3.8-minimal - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.9
libpython3.8-stdlib - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.9
libpython3.8-testsuite - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.9
python3.8 - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.9
python3.8-examples - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.9
python3.8-full - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.9
python3.8-minimal - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.9
python3.8-venv - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.9
No subscription required

idle-python3.9 - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
libpython3.9 - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
libpython3.9-minimal - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
libpython3.9-stdlib - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
libpython3.9-testsuite - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
python3.9 - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
python3.9-examples - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
python3.9-full - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
python3.9-minimal - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
python3.9-venv - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
python3.8 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.9').
python3.9 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.9.5-3~20.04.1').
